poem:
"Inequity Manifest"

From Notting Hill, wealthy hearts fill,
More than Liverpool, Manchester, Newcastle's mill.
Capital gains amass in few hands,
While the dour worker merely stands,
Seeing not the fruits of toil;
Trade their joy for grinding moil.
The bell tolls not for these alone -
Injustice seed, widely sown,
Growing towers over common man,
Weighing down our shared life-span.
